intro: Lasianthus chunii, commonly known as the Chinese flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine, velvety texture. Lasianthus chunii thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
